H0.text: Light years are the unit astronomers use to describe distances in space.

H1.text: Quantum years is the unit astronomers use to describe distances in space.

H2.text: Light months are the unit astronomers use to describe distances in space.

H3.text: Gravity years are the unit astronomers use to describe distances in space.

A4.text: The unit most commonly used in professional astronomy is the parsec (symbol: pc, about 3.26 light-years).

A5.text: Light-years are also popularly used to gauge the expanses of interstellar and intergalactic space.
